text:
NotificationListener.subscribe() requires an integer for the depth parameter.
AbstractWebdavMethod expects one of "0", "1" or "infinity" for the depth header.
It is impossible to pass "infinity" to the subscribe() method.

Either subscribe() needs to special-case DepthSupport.DEPTH_INFINITY and convert
it to "infinity", or the signature of the method needs to be changed to accept a
String.

This is blocking cluster cache notifications.
creator: masonjm@ah.org
dflorey@apache.org
text:
Use Integer.MAX_VALUE to subscribe for infinite depth. This is the way it is
done in most Slide methods. Ugly, but works.
If we change it here, we should change it everywhere...

creator: masonjm@ah.org
text:
Are you sure this works? The code in AbstractWebdavMethod seems to be looking
for one of three values, "0", "1", or "infinity". If it doesn't find one of
those values it sends an http 412 response (precondition failed).

See lines 1377 and 1657 in AbstractWebdavMethod.
I've verified that Integer.MAX_VALUE causes the same error.

text: DepthSupport.DEPTH_INFINITY is now special-cased to send "infinity" header.
